oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Growth factors in Penaeid shrimp feeding
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Guillaume, Julien
Cruz, R
Cuzon, Gerard
Wormhoudt Van, A
Revol, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Penaeus japonicus
Food absorption
Digestive system
Haemolymph
Amino acids
Glucose
Digestion
Enzymes
Experimental research
Feeding
Shrimp culture
Laboratory culture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Some nutrients known as non essential in vertebrates could be essential in invertebrates and could be related to some "unknown growth factors" which were evidenced or suspected, mainly in mollusc or crustacean flesh or meal, by several authors working on different species of crustaceans. A set of experiments was carried out in our laboratory in order to isolate one of these factors found in squid meal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Actes de colloques. Ifremer. Brest [ACTES COLLOQ. IFREMER.]. 1990
